availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Manlius V. Sinclair (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Scott County resident in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in 1850. Married to Henrietta Josephine Gorham on October 2, 1851, in Scott County. Father of John W. Sinclair, Mollie A. Sinclair, Waller R. Sinclair, Medora A. Sinclair, Benjamin W. Sinclair, Callie M. Sinclair, and Lidia L. Sinclair. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 473B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 939.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 21.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225, p. 226.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Texas, Navarro County, Corsicana/District 138, p. 502A.
